title: Worksheet 1: Getting Started with Print
description: Learn the basics of Python's print function with lots of practice

problems.title: What is print()?
problems.content: The print() function makes Python show text on the screen. It's one of the most important functions in Python!
problems.task: Type the example code and run it to see what happens.
problems.hint: Make sure you have quotes around the text!

rules.description: Code must contain the exact print statement

problems.title: Your First Print
problems.content: Now try printing your own message!
problems.task: Write a program that prints "My name is [your name]"
problems.hint: Replace [your name] with your actual name in quotes

rules.description: Code must contain a print statement
Code must be substantial (not just comments)

problems.title: Print a Number
problems.content: You can print numbers without quotes!
problems.hint: Numbers don't need quotes around them

problems.title: Multiple Prints
problems.content: You can use multiple print statements to create different lines
problems.task: Write two print statements: one that prints your favorite color, and another that prints your favorite food
problems.starterCode:
# Print your favorite color

# Print your favorite food
problems.hint: Each print() creates a new line automatically

rules.description: Must have at least 2 print statements
Output must have at least 2 lines

problems.title: Print Challenge
problems.task:
Create a program that prints:
1. Your name
2. Your age (as a number)
3. "I love Python!"
problems.starterCode:
# Print your name

# Print your age (as a number)

# Print "I love Python!"
problems.hint: Remember: text needs quotes, numbers don't!

rules.description: Must have at least 3 print statements
Output must have at least 3 lines
